April 8, 19&
Miss Barbara Kenaaly
Permissions Deportment
Alfred A* Knopf, Inc.
457 Madison Avenue
Hew York 22, New York
Dear Miss Kenealy:
We are grateful for your authorization to reprint and broadcast
"Disillusionment at Ten O'clock" including the credits which you have
recommended in your letter of March 30.
All of the other publishers whom we have contacted in connection with
this effort have arranged to provide such authorization without charge,
and both the Voice of America and the H.A.E.B. would be grateful indeed
if we could Impose upon the Knopf Publishing Company to make the same
arrangements. Ho doubt this is a rather unusual request all the way around,
so we hope it will be possible to provide this extra consideration.
We will be most grateful to you for any efforts you may be able to exert
in our behalf, and look forward to hearing from you shortly*
Sincerely,
James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
